segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these release notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP2.
segment.target: Read these release notes thoroughly before you install Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP2.

segment.source: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2.
segment.target: These release notes contain information that is required to successfully install Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2.

segment.source: The release notes also contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: The release notes also contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these release notes and other App-V 4.6 SP2 documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these release notes and other App-V 4.6 SP2 documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.

segment.source: About the Product Documentation
segment.target: About the Product Documentation

segment.source: For more information about documentation for App-V, see the Application Virtualization page on Microsoft TechNet.
segment.target: For more information about documentation for App-V, see the Application Virtualization page on Microsoft TechNet.

segment.source: Providing feedback
segment.target: Providing feedback

segment.source: We are interested in your feedback on App-V 4.6 SP2.
segment.target: We are interested in your feedback on App-V 4.6 SP2.

segment.source: You can send your feedback to mdopdocs@microsoft.com.
segment.target: You can send your feedback to mdopdocs@microsoft.com.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This email address is not a support channel, but your feedback will help us to plan future changes for our documentation and product releases.
segment.target: This email address is not a support channel, but your feedback will help us to plan future changes for our documentation and product releases.

segment.source: For the latest information about MDOP and additional learning resources, see the MDOP Information Experience page.
segment.target: For the latest information about MDOP and additional learning resources, see the MDOP Information Experience page.

segment.source: For more information about new updates or to provide feedback, follow us on Facebook or Twitter.
segment.target: For more information about new updates or to provide feedback, follow us on Facebook or Twitter.

segment.source: Known Issues with App-V 4.6 SP2
segment.target: Known Issues with App-V 4.6 SP2

segment.source: Short file name support is disabled for non-system physical drives when you sequence
segment.target: Short file name support is disabled for non-system physical drives when you sequence

segment.source: When you sequence on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012, support for short file names (8.3) is disabled by default for non-system physical drives.
segment.target: When you sequence on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012, support for short file names (8.3) is disabled by default for non-system physical drives.

segment.source: The underlying physical drive associated with the primary virtual application directory (for example, “Q:appname”) on the sequencing station must provide short file name (8.3) support in order for the App-V 4.6 SP2 Sequencer to generate short file names when creating virtual application packages.
segment.target: The underlying physical drive associated with the primary virtual application directory (for example, “Q:appname”) on the sequencing station must provide short file name (8.3) support in order for the App-V 4.6 SP2 Sequencer to generate short file names when creating virtual application packages.

segment.source: Short file name (8.3) support is disabled by default for non-system physical drives on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: Short file name (8.3) support is disabled by default for non-system physical drives on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: Workaround: Enable short file name (8.3) support on non-system physical drives.
segment.target: Workaround: Enable short file name (8.3) support on non-system physical drives.

segment.source: You can use the following command to enable short file name support on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: You can use the following command to enable short file name support on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: For example, use the following command if the drive letter is “Q:”:
segment.target: For example, use the following command if the drive letter is “Q:”:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You do not need to change this setting on the App-V client because the App-V file system properly handles short paths on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: You do not need to change this setting on the App-V client because the App-V file system properly handles short paths on Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: App-V does not override the default handler for file type or protocol associations on Windows 8
segment.target: App-V does not override the default handler for file type or protocol associations on Windows 8

segment.source: If you select a default application by using Default Programs in Control Panel on Windows 8, App-V will not override the associated file type associations for that application.
segment.target: If you select a default application by using Default Programs in Control Panel on Windows 8, App-V will not override the associated file type associations for that application.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: Virtualized Outlook 2010 is not offered as an option for mailto clickable links on Windows 8
segment.target: Virtualized Outlook 2010 is not offered as an option for mailto clickable links on Windows 8

segment.source: The mailto shell extension does not offer virtualized Outlook 2010 on Windows 8.
segment.target: The mailto shell extension does not offer virtualized Outlook 2010 on Windows 8.

segment.source: For example, if you click a mailto: link from virtualized Outlook 2010 that is running on Windows 8, a new email window is not created.
segment.target: For example, if you click a mailto: link from virtualized Outlook 2010 that is running on Windows 8, a new email window is not created.

segment.source: This option works correctly on Windows 7 and earlier versions of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: This option works correctly on Windows 7 and earlier versions of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: Workaround: None.
segment.target: Workaround: None.

segment.source: Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2 update is not offered on all locales that use Microsoft Update
segment.target: Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2 update is not offered on all locales that use Microsoft Update

segment.source: When you use Microsoft Update, the update for App-V 4.6 SP2 is not available for the following language locales:
segment.target: When you use Microsoft Update, the update for App-V 4.6 SP2 is not available for the following language locales:

segment.source: Kazakh
segment.target: Kazakh

segment.source: Hindi
segment.target: Hindi

segment.source: Serbian-Cyrillic
segment.target: Serbian-Cyrillic

segment.source: Workaround: If you are using Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), use the English version of the update or download the update from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
segment.target: Workaround: If you are using Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), use the English version of the update or download the update from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
